Hi Guys,

I'm just wondering.  Have the JUnit developers considered adding =
dependency annotations to JUnit?  You could annotate your code with say 

"=
@TestDependency Test1 public void myTest() {code;}", which would cause myTe=
st() to depend on Test1 running it's tests first.

A scenario where this mi=
ght be needed...
1. Test1 inserts DB records
2. Nightly job runs (but can b=
e run manually by user)
3. Test2.myTest() then runs, as #2 has completed, a=
nd myTest() now has data that can be used.

In the case of #2, it would nee=
d to give the user enough time to run the nightly job, manually.

I'm wanti=
ng to test everything in a totally automated way.  But at this point, it is=
 not entirely possible.

I just wanted to ask about this, as you guys proba=
bly have a lot more experience in why this is or is not a good idea.

Thank=
s.
